{"step_by_step_thinking": "Intermediate filaments are a type of cytoskeletal protein that provide structural support to cells. They are composed of various types of monomeric subunits. To determine which of the options is not a monomeric intermediate filament, we need to identify which one does not belong to this category. 

A. Vimentin is a type III intermediate filament protein found in mesenchymal cells.
B. Keratin is a type I and type II intermediate filament protein found in epithelial cells.
C. Desmin is a type III intermediate filament protein found in muscle cells.
D. Tubulin is not an intermediate filament protein, but rather a component of microtubules, which are another type of cytoskeletal protein. 

Based on this information, the answer is D. Tubulin.", "answer_choice": "D"}
